pullRequest.body:
Characterizations for the smoothness of maps into the total spaces of (1) the direct sum of two vector bundles; (2) the pullback of a vector bundle.

This gap in the library was exposed by #17358.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [8e431b9c34](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17627/commits/8e431b9c34429d26a315c4a7e6a141895527b741)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Bundle.Prod.continuous_fst`
`+ Bundle.Prod.smooth_fst`
`+ Bundle.Prod.smooth_of_smooth_fst_comp_of_smooth_snd_comp`
`+ Bundle.Prod.smooth_snd`
`+ Bundle.Pullback.smooth_lift`
`+ Bundle.Pullback.smooth_of_smooth_proj_comp_of_smooth_lift_comp`
`+ FiberBundle.Prod.continuous_of_continuous_fst_comp_of_continuous_snd_comp`
`+ FiberBundle.Prod.continuous_snd`
`+ Pullback.continuous_of_continuous_proj_comp_of_smooth_lift_comp`
`+ TotalSpace.Prod.fst`
`+ TotalSpace.Prod.snd`
`+ smoothOn_trivializationAt`
`+ smoothOn_trivializationAt_symm`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

I'm a little bit surprised you need the fact that the bundles are smooth here: after all, when you read the map in charts, it should be the map `(b, f_1, f_2) -> (b, f_1)`, which is always smooth. Or am I missing something?

(Especially because you don't need it below)

```suggestion
/-- Given two smooth fiber bundles `E`, `E` over a manifold `B`, if `` is a map into the total
```
Is it worth also stating the iff version, to be able to rewrite easily?
I'd rather have `omit ... in` in individual statements (or global reorganization), otherwise it's hard to know what the standing assumptions are exactly.

pullRequest.title: feat: universal properties of vector bundle constructions

source.title: feat: the Lie algebra of a Lie group over R or C
